#define MM_READ_ERR ( buffer,
size,
count   )     if (p3utils->anchor == NULL || (count = read (p3utils->anchor->fd, buffer, size)) < 0)

Macro: MM_READ_ERR

Description:
If the mmap anchor has not been allocated or there is an error reading from the RAM disk, then the caller must handle the error. Otherwise, the amount a data read is returned.
Parameters:
  • buffer: An allocated buffer space.
  • size: The amount of data to read, which must be less than or equal to the size of the buffer space.
  • count: The amount of data successfully read.

#define MM_WRITE_ERR ( buffer,
size   )     if (p3utils->anchor == NULL || write(p3utils->anchor->fd, buffer, size) < 0)

Macro: MM_WRITE_ERR

Description:
If the mmap anchor has not been allocated or there is an error writing to the RAM disk, then the caller must handle the error.
Parameters:
  • buffer: The buffer of data to write.
  • size: The amount of data to write, which must be less than or equal to the size of the buffer space.

int init_kernel_comm (  ) 

Function:
init_kernel_comm
Description:
Initialize the buffer used for communication with the kernel module.
NOTE: The init_key_serv function is only called by a primary to initialize the circular buffer for random numbers.

Inputs:
  • None
Outputs:
  • int: Status
    • 0 = OK
    • <0 = Error

Function:
send_ioctl
Description:
Send a buffer to the kernel module using an ioctl command.
Inputs:
  • buffer: The data to be sent.
  • size: The size of the data buffer.
Outputs:
  • int: Status
    • 0 = OK
    • <0 = Error

void p3errmsg ( int  type,
char *  message 
)

Function:
p3errmsg
Description:
Handle error messages for the P3 system. The types of messages are defined in the p3base.h include file. They are:
  • Critical: Caused by system errors
  • Error: Caused by application errors
  • Warning: Does not cause application shutdown, but indicate the need for adminstrative correction
  • Notice: Information that is always reported, such as startup
  • Information: Information such as usage statistics. This may be ignored using the -I command line argument
Inputs:
  • type: The type of the message
  • message: The text of the message
Outputs:
  • None
Function:
p3errmsg
Description:
Handle error messages for the P3 system. The types of messages are defined in the p3kbase.h include file. They are:
  • Critical: Caused by system errors
  • Error: Caused by application errors
  • Warning: Does not cause application shutdown, but indicate the need for adminstrative correction
  • Notice: Information that is always reported, such as startup
  • Information: Information such as usage statistics. This may be ignored using the -I command line argument
Inputs:
  • type: The type of the message
  • message: The text of the message
Outputs:
  • None

int isallnum ( char *  parm  ) 

Function:
isallnum
Description:
Validate that a string is only base 10 digits.
Inputs:
  • parm: The string to be tested.
Outputs:
  • int: Status
    • 0 = Only digits
    • <0 = String contains non-digits
